alert.note: Alert for Cascade Foothills in Lane County; Cascades in Lane County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued October 21 at 9:30AM PDT until October 22 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: .An incoming storm system will produce a period of moderate to heavy rainfall tonight across the central Cascades of Oregon, including the Cedar Creek burned area. Please refer to the impacts below for specific locations of concern. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE CEDAR CREEK FIRE BURN SCAR IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over and downstream/downriver of the Cedar Creek Fire burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Oregon, including the following areas, Cascade Foothills in eastern Lane County and the Cascades in eastern Lane County. This includes Oakridge and Westfir. * WHEN...From 5 PM PDT this afternoon through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Cedar Creek Fire burn scar is expected during the period of the watch. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Residents near the Cedar Creek Fire burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Debris flows could then move downstream along Salmon Creek flowing into Oakridge, the North Fork of the Middle Fork of the Willamette River flowing into Westfir, and Salt Creek and adjoining infrastructure including Oregon highway 58. Debris might eventually flow down river as far as Lookout Point Reservoir. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall exceeding 1 inch in less than 6 hours over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Cascade Foothills in Lane County; Cascades in Lane County
